intro: Schizoglossum stenoglossum, commonly known as the narrow-lipped schizoglossum, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, branched stems with alternate, pinnately divided leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in compound umbels, a common trait among members of its family. Schizoglossum stenoglossum is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens.
